column4: is there anything out there that helps windows users get their feet wet with ubuntu in virtualbox?
does wubi have that sort of thing?
installing.  i have a friend that wants to start developing GUI apps in python, but pygtk support on windows is godawful
I dunno really, Ubuntu/Debian is pretty easy to install (easier than windows). Just add the required python libs (kde and gtk) and he's good to go.
oh yeah for sure, it's just he's currently on windows, and i'm trying to figure out the best way to get him ubuntu for development :-)
So you would like a website to install the basic programming env?
no, just an easy way to get ubuntu into a vm on his machine, since he's certainly not ready to switch
Oh, just a vm, im way way off topic then :D

:-p, well the ULTIMATE goal is just to get him programming using pygtk, but pygtk seems to be horribly broken, or at least a pain on windows (considering how many dependencies gtk+ has, that kind of stuff without a package manager is nothing short of hellish)
Yes, you need a package manager. :P
and pygtk is a mess in linux as it is on windows. it's the same thing
in fact it's generally already installed since most of ubuntu's nice helper programs are written in using pygtk
yes, its easy to install, i just meant the api is still the same ...
oh, i love the api, best way to create GUIs with any language on any platform IMHO
